title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Uno Minda to invest in solar power SPV for renewable energy sourcing
Solar module exporters look for new markets
items.author: Parag Dave
items.summary:
- **Gujarat-based solar module exporters** face 50% US tariffs, with India exporting about 7 GW of modules to the US worth around ₹10,000 crore, and Gujarat accounting for about 70% of that share.
- *Domestic demand is rising*, exporters will prioritize the Indian market while eyeing new markets in Europe, though Chinese competition may be tough.
- *Industry voices* warn margins will tighten under tariff pressure, but solar energy growth is creating new global opportunities as countries deploy cheaper solar power.

items.title: India’s bioeconomy hits $165.7B, eyes $300B by 2030
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- From $10B in 2014 to $165.7B in 2024, India’s *bioeconomy* targets **$300B** by 2030, driven by *biopharma*, *biomanufacturing*, agriculture and research.
- The sector’s mix is **47%** *bioindustrial*, **35%** *biopharma*, **8%** *bioagri*, **9%** *bioresearch*.
- India is a growing *vaccine hub* with Serum Institute’s 2024 share at 24% (excluding COVID) and 40% of WHO vaccine procurement; ethanol blending reached 20% in petrol by 2025.

items.title: Gujarat and UP take wings in India's global chip flight
items.summary:
- *Gujarat* leads with mega bets, including a $2.75B Micron fab in Sanand and an $11B Tata Electronics-PSMC project in Dholera, anchoring India’s chip map.
- *Uttar Pradesh* shifts strategic gears with the HCL-Foxconn Jewar venture ($435M), targeting 20,000 wafers/month and 36M display-driver chips monthly, by 2027.
- Elsewhere, Assam, Odisha, Punjab and Andhra Pradesh are warming up; a *dual-centre model* grows, but execution hinges on talent, supply chains and stable policy.

items.title: Customer-centric digital manufacturing
items.summary:
- Tata Motors embeds customer voice early via a structured NTD process to push only market-ready ideas.
- Digital twins and the **3DEXPERIENCE** platform accelerate co-development with startups and validate concepts virtually before physical build.
- The shift to *customer experience* and digital continuity links design to delivery, personalization, and lifecycle value.

items.title: Handicraft exporters look to diversify into domestic market
items.summary:
- The 5% GST on handicrafts is aimed at boosting *domestic demand* as exporters tap into India's **140 crore** market.
- Some firms welcome the shift, but layoffs are feared as the order pipeline dries up; growth hinges on diversifying to the **domestic market** and opening new export markets with govt *support*.
- Gems and jewellery GST stays at 3%; long-term relief depends on new markets and policies like *market assistance funds* to help exporters attend global fairs.

items.title: Dassault to take majority stake in jet JV with Reliance
items.summary: - Dassault will buy 2% stake to raise its share to **51%** in the Dassault Reliance Aerospace JV for ₹176 crore.\n- The deal values the JV at ₹8,798 crore and strengthens *Nagpur*-based manufacturing of Rafale and Falcon jet components.\n- By 2028, Falcon 2000 jets will be made in *India* for the first time outside France, with a backlog of 75 Falcons and FY25 turnover ₹70 crore.

items.title: Hansgrohe to quadruple India production as China slows
items.summary:
- Hansgrohe plans to *quadruple India production* as *China sales slow*, boosting diversification in a fast-growing market.
- Mumbai will scale to *200,000 fittings annually by 2028*, with India projected to contribute *10% of global sales by 2030*.
- The push includes expanding distributors to *400* and opening an experience centre in *New Delhi* for live demos.

items.title: L&T Semicon acquires FGEL power module assets
items.summary: - L&T Semiconductor Technologies has acquired *R&D equipment*, *design patents* and *intellectual property* related to Fujitsu General Electronics' *power module* technologies. - This acquisition strengthens LTSCT's *global intellectual property* portfolio and *design capabilities*, aligning with its vision to deliver world-class semiconductor solutions worldwide. - The deal will accelerate LTSCT's foray into *power electronics design* and broaden its portfolio across *industrial*, *energy* and *automotive* applications, FGEL's Tadashi Hasegawa noted.

items.title: MNCs eye JVs in India's semiconductor sector - Yes Securities
items.summary:
- MNCs are eyeing joint ventures to enter India's semiconductor sector, signaling rising external interest *Yes Securities*.
- Government incentives and programs (**fab incentives**, **DLI**, **PLI**, **ISM 2.0**) aim to lift value addition to 30–35% and grow the market toward $100–110B by 2030.
- India's design and IP ambitions are advancing with 23 chip-design projects sanctioned and ~72 companies granted EDA tools, positioning the country as a global hub.

items.title: No reduction in overall cargo shipments from India: Sonowal
items.summary:
- *Sonowal* said there has been no reduction in overall cargo shipments from India despite the 50% tariff on Indian goods. 
- Almost 90% of India's foreign trade by volume and 70% by value is moved by sea. 
- Five rounds of US talks are ongoing amid tariff tensions; VOC Port's green hydrogen project signals maritime sector progress.

items.title: GST reforms will mitigate US tariff impact on Indian economy, says secondary steel industry body
items.summary:
- *GST reforms* will boost demand and help the *secondary steel sector*, mitigating the impact of US tariffs on the Indian economy, according to Yogesh Mandhani.
- He called for *mining policy reforms* to increase *iron ore availability* and lower raw material costs, which could boost exports and steel competitiveness.
- He urged *one nation one tariff* with power tariff rationalisation and a push into export markets to lift capacity utilisation (current ~68–70%).

items.title: Government to greenlight incentives for green steel output
items.summary:
- The government is firming up a **Green Steel Mission** with a **₹5,000 crore** package to incentivise sustainable steel production for both primary and secondary producers. 
- The plan includes **concessional loans**, **risk guarantees**, and incentives for **renewable energy** and a **Production Linked Incentive** to push cleaner tech in secondary steel producers using *electric arc furnaces* and *induction furnaces*. 
- It could launch after approvals in the next financial year as officials seek to close gaps in technology adoption to meet India's **net-zero** targets.

items.title: Sonowal inaugurates port-based green hydrogen at VOC Port
items.summary:
- The 10 Nm³/hr VOC Port pilot will generate **green hydrogen** to power streetlights and an EV charging station, at a cost of ₹3.87 crore. 
- Foundation stones for **green methanol bunkering** (750 m³) and the **Coastal Green Shipping Corridor** (Kandla–Tuticorin) signal broader port decarbonisation efforts. 
- Rooftop solar to 1.04 MW, a ₹24.5 crore link conveyor, a 6 MW wind farm, a ₹90 crore multi-cargo berth, and MoUs with **IPRCL** and **NTPC** boost rail connectivity and green mobility.

items.title: JK Cement to invest ₹3,000 crore in new Jaisalmer plant
items.summary:
- JK Cement has started a *greenfield cement plant* in Jaisalmer, Rajasthan, with an investment of about **₹3,000 crore** on 525 acres. 
- The project, slated for completion by early 2027, leverages limestone reserves for raw material security and aims to boost regional employment and skill development in Rajasthan, Gujarat and Haryana. 
- It will deploy technologies such as *waste heat recovery* to improve energy efficiency and support India’s infrastructure and housing needs with a lower carbon footprint.

items.title: Hitachi to invest $1B in US power grid
items.summary:
- **Hitachi** plans to invest **$1 billion** to expand US power grid manufacturing, including a major facility in *South Boston, Virginia* to produce large power transformers.
- About **$457 million** of the investment will fund the Virginia plant, aiming to be the biggest US producer of large transformers, with production slated to start in **2028**.
- The move aligns with the White House push to boost domestic energy capacity for **AI data centers**, as utilities ramp up grid spending to meet rising demand.

items.title: GST rate cut on raw materials offers lifeline to struggling fertilizer manufacturers
SDAL blast highlights dual defence oversight
items.author: Shishir Arya
items.summary:
- Private SDAL is regulated by **PESO** under the *Explosives Act*, while ordnance factories fall under **CFEES**, a DRDO unit.
- The SDAL blast is being probed by **PESO**, with theories of *mechanical* and *human* error and the final report to be submitted to the district collector.
- PESO's inspections face staff shortages and no fixed schedule; private factories remain outside **CFEES**, underscoring safety-regulation gaps highlighted by past incidents like the Jan 2025 Bhandara blast.

items.title: AI reshaping manufacturing: predictive maintenance
items.summary:
- *AI*-driven tools forecast indirect material consumption, cut inventory, and improve cash flow, reshaping manufacturing and supply chains with *predictive maintenance* and *intelligent automation*. 
- Factories and supply chains are becoming smart, adaptive systems that minimize downtime and optimize production in volatile markets. 
- Leaders say embedding *AI* at the core of strategy and culture drives resilience, *sustainability*, and lasting value in a transformed industrial era.

items.title: Fujifilm plans semiconductor materials factory in India
items.author: Pankaj Doval
items.summary:
- Fujifilm Electronic Materials plans to set up a factory in *Dholera, Gujarat* to support India’s growing fab ecosystem. 
- It is evaluating three options: production by itself; licensed production by Indian firms; and a **joint venture** with semiconductor manufacturers. 
- India’s skilled workforce and strong tech base, along with the government’s push to attract investments, could make this a *long-term* hub for semiconductor materials.

items.title: Japanese firms to shape India's semiconductor chain: Deloitte
items.summary: - *Deloitte India* says Japan's leadership in materials and equipment can fast-track India's journey to a $100B semiconductor market by 2030.\n- The report identifies five value-chain areas for collaboration: Fab equipment, materials, packaging/testing (OSAT/ATMP), design/R&D, and talent development.\n- It notes ongoing partnerships and investments, including India–Japan supply chain initiatives, to scale India's semiconductor ecosystem.

items.title: India's food processing sector to reach $535B by 2026
items.summary:
- *Growth is driven by ayurveda, herbal and organic products, and FSSAI's Aahara standards emphasising actives and nutraceuticals.*
- **AI automation** and *smart packaging* are redefining the industry, with India poised to become a global hub for food and packaging materials.
- *India's organic food market* is projected to grow at a CAGR of **20.13%** to $10.8 billion by 2033.

items.title: SEMICON India 2025 boosts India's semiconductor leadership
items.summary: - SEMICON India 2025, organised by ISM and **SEMI**, attracted 350+ exhibitors from 33 countries and 15,000+ visitors, strengthening India’s bid to become a **global semiconductor leader**; ISM has committed nearly ₹65,000 crore. - Tech focus includes **Silicon Carbide (SiC)** devices and **3D glass packaging**, with initiatives like the Workforce Development Pavilion and the SEMI University Programme to train 1 million skilled workers by 2030. - India aims to diversify supply chains, boost domestic manufacturing and indigenous design, and deepen partnerships with global players such as **ASML**.

items.title: SEMICON India 2025: India's rise in semiconductors
items.summary:
- The event drew 35,000 registrations, 30,000 footfalls, and 25,000 online views, underscoring India's growing role in the global *semiconductor ecosystem*. 
- With 350+ exhibitors, 48 countries, four country pavilions, and a workforce development pavilion, the three-day conference boosted cross-border collaboration and *research commercialization* under the *India Semiconductor Mission*. 
- PM Modi inaugurated the event, stating that India is creating a *semiconductor ecosystem* that makes the country *self-reliant* and globally competitive.

items.title: Varun Beverages forms JV with Everest to make refrigerators
items.summary: - *Varun Beverages* forms a 50% *joint venture* with *Everest International Holdings* to manufacture *visi-coolers* and other refrigeration equipment under the banner *White Peak Refrigeration*.\n- The company has invested ₹21.25 crore to own 2,12,50,000 equity shares in *White Peak Refrigeration Pvt Ltd* and has also taken a 50% stake in *Everest Industrial Lanka Pvt Ltd*.\n- With new facilities at Prayagraj, Damtal, Buxar and Mendipathar, the JV aims to boost production and distribution, following VBL's Q2 CY25 results.

items.title: Gem, jewellery sector backs domestic demand amid US tariffs
items.summary:
- The *GST rationalisation*, including a 5% rate on many items, and the *DIAS* exemption for certain diamonds, are expected to boost *domestic demand* and ease working capital amid the 50% *US tariffs*. 
- Industry bodies like the *GJEPC* say GST cuts and lower packaging costs will boost affordability for buyers, even as exports face tariff headwinds. 
- With India's *7.8% GDP growth* in Q1 FY2026 and diamond jewellery worth about *$8.5 billion*, the sector remains optimistic about becoming a leading *jewellery hub* driven by domestic demand.

items.title: Zydus Lifesciences inks US generic Zeposia deal with Synthon
items.summary:
- *Zydus Lifesciences has signed an exclusive licensing and supply deal with Synthon BV to market Ozanimod Capsules (generic Zeposia) in the US.*
- *Under the terms, Synthon will secure final FDA ANDA approval and manage manufacturing and supply, while Zydus handles commercialization.*
- *Synthon already received tentative FDA approval and is eligible for a 180-day exclusivity on launch, boosting its competitive position in MS and UC therapies.*

items.title: Reliance Infra unit to transfer 2% stake in DRAL
items.summary: - *2% stake* in *Dassault Reliance Aerospace (DRAL)*, valued at ₹175.96 crore, signed on 5 September 2025, to complete by 1 November 2025.\n- DRAL will move from a *51% subsidiary* to an associate, with *Reliance Aerostructure* holding 49% and *Dassault Aviation* 51%.\n- DRAL's turnover as of 31 March 2025 was ₹69.93 crore and net worth ₹47.13 crore; Dassault Aviation is not part of Reliance's promoter group.

items.title: Acronis-Intel AI threat detection partnership
items.summary:
- Acronis and Intel announced Cyber Protect Cloud on AI PCs powered by Intel Core Ultra processors to enable real-time threat detection on endpoints with minimal performance impact. 
- The integration uses Intel's OpenVINO to offload AI tasks to the processor's NPU, reportedly cutting CPU load by up to 92% and extending battery life. 
- The SaaS platform combines antimalware, email security, data loss prevention, EDR, automated backups and DR, aligning with NIST cyber functions to identify, protect, detect, respond and recover.

items.title: DMRL transfers advanced defence technologies to industry partners
Drones ready for take-off with simpler tax structure
items.summary:
- The *GST* on UAVs was simplified: commercial drones now attract **5% GST**, while military drones and related gear are fully exempt.
- The change is expected to speed up adoption across agriculture, logistics, surveillance, and defence, and reduce compliance costs.
- Industry leaders say the move could spur innovation and boost defence contracts as drone tech remains a strategic priority.

items.title: GRSE inks pact with Merlinhawk Aerospace for naval ship composite doors
Rajasthan govt amends Factories Act, 1948, to benefit workers and women
Hindustan Zinc cuts freshwater use by 28%, saves 71 billion litres in a decade
Singapore eyes MRO investment in India: MEA
items.summary:
- *MEA* Secretary (East) P Kumaran said Singapore aims to invest in *MRO* facilities to build capacity in *India* and strengthen civil aviation cooperation.
- *SIA Engineering* plans to partner with *Tata* in the *MRO* sector, leveraging Singapore Airlines’ stake in Air India to develop capacity in India.
- Five *MoUs* cover green/digital shipping, space collaboration, civil aviation R&D/training, digital asset innovation, and a Chennai skilling centre; *BMCT* phase II at *JNP* signals stronger connectivity.

items.title: Kaynes' Sanand OSAT unit to start production from 2026
items.author: Suraksha P, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Kaynes Semicon *OSAT* in *Sanand* is entering critical product validation ahead of commercial production planned for early 2026, with pilot operations started in April and an anchor customer, *Alpha Omega Semiconductor*. 
- The project has about ₹400 crore already committed, part of a ₹3,307 crore total investment funded 50% by the Centre, 20% by Gujarat, and 30% by Kaynes. 
- Mass production is slated after validation, with Alpha Omega deliveries starting in October and full-scale output by January, while Kaynes pursues partnerships and global training.

items.title: Drone startups to spend gains from GST cut on R&D
Apple’s India sales hit record $9 billion after retail expansion
items.summary: - Apple’s India sales near *$9B*, up ~13% to last fiscal year, per Bloomberg.\n- *iPhones* led demand as retail expands in Bengaluru and Pune, with Noida/Mumbai on the way, and India designated a separate sales region.\n- Apple is increasing *Made-in-India* production (about 20% of iPhones) to serve the US market, while high import taxes keep prices high, prompting discounts and trade-ins in the market.

items.title: GST cut to lower renewable project costs; hike in oil, gas rates to raise upstream burden
Clean energy installs to get cheaper after GST cut
items.summary:
- The GST on renewable energy devices and parts is cut from *12%* to *5%*, aiming to promote adoption of *green power*. 
- The rate cut applies to PV cells, solar modules, solar power devices, wind generators, etc., with refunds for inverted duty structure. 
- Industry leaders say lower costs will boost demand, accelerate capacity addition, attract investment, and support India's 2030 clean-energy targets.

items.title: GST cut on renewables boosts investor confidence
items.summary:
- The GST reduction from 12% to 5% on renewable energy equipment lowers project costs and eases long-standing tax credit issues, boosting *investor confidence*. 
- Industry leaders expect improved tariff competitiveness and faster deployment of *solar, wind, hybrid, and storage* projects nationwide. 
- The reform is seen as a boon for domestic manufacturing, reducing unutilised GST credits and supporting India's 2030 target of 500 GW non-fossil capacity.

items.title: Cadence Design to buy Hexagon's design and engineering unit for $3.16 billion
items.summary: - *Cadence Design* to buy *Hexagon AB*'s *D&E* unit for **€2.7B** (~$3.16B), with **70% cash** and the rest in shares.\n- The deal broadens *Cadence Design*'s customers (Nvidia, Qualcomm; VW, BMW, Lockheed Martin) and adds *Hexagon's D&E* software for *structural and multibody dynamics*; 2024 revenue ~**€265M** and 1,100+ employees.\n- Closure expected in *Q1 2026*; reverse termination fee up to **€175M**; follows *BETA CAE Systems* acquisition.

items.title: NITI Aayog pushes early 2D materials for semiconductors
items.summary:
- *NITI Aayog* calls for an early push to develop **2D materials** for semiconductors to gain leadership rather than play catch-up.
- 2D materials are reportedly about 8 lakh times thinner than a pencil tip, far stronger than steel, and could enable chips up to 10x smaller than today’s smallest nodes.
- The push urges investing in people, R&D, supply chains, standards, and alliances to build a home-grown ecosystem and secure a first-mover edge in semiconductors.

items.title: Texas Instruments flags demand slowdown after tariff-driven spike
Chinese firms still want Nvidia chips despite government pressure not to buy
CynLr and IISc partner on neuroscience-led robotics research
items.summary:
- The collaboration, Visual Neuroscience for Cybernetics, will apply *neuroscience* insights on depth and motion to *robotic vision systems* that learn without prior training. 
- CynLr and IISc’s *Vision Lab* (led by Professor *SP Arun*) will drive joint research, algorithm development and training, with doctoral and early-career researchers joining CynLr. 
- Building on CynLr’s global track (EPFL, CSEM) to develop adaptable robots for real-world complexity; the program remains open to other academic partners.

items.title: Tata Electronics, Merck sign MoU to boost India semiconductors
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- The **MoU** enables Tata Electronics and **Merck** to collaborate on semiconductor materials, fabrication infrastructure, and specialty chemicals and gases in India.
- **Merck** will supply its portfolio—high-purity electronic materials, advanced gas and chemical delivery systems, turnkey fab infrastructure, and Athinia data analytics—to Tata Electronics’ planned **Dholera fab**, along with safety and manufacturing best practices.
- The partnership includes localised warehousing, supply chain development, talent cultivation, and industry standards; it supports the **India Semiconductor Mission**; Tata Electronics will build India's first fab in **Dholera** with about ₹91,000 crore, producing chips for automotive, mobile, and AI applications.

items.title: India looking beyond US for pharma exports amid tariff tensions
items.summary:
- *India* is seeking to diversify pharma exports beyond the US by targeting semi-regulated markets in Africa, Latin America and Southeast Asia to reduce tariff risk.
- *Pharmexcil* plans to push finished-drug sales to *China* to bridge the trade deficit, as India imports over 60% of its raw materials and APIs from China.
- The US remains India’s largest pharma market, but tariff tensions persist; India is also eyeing growth in other markets, including Russia, the Netherlands and Brazil.

items.title: JSW Cement to boost capacity 65% by 2028
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary: - *JSW Cement* will raise capacity by *65%* to about *34 million tonnes* by 2028, with EBITDA per tonne targeted at *₹1,150–1,200* and capex around *₹2,000 crore*.\n- The group is pursuing *greenfield and brownfield expansions* to reach *33.85 MT by 2028*, plus plans to hit *41.85 MT* later at Vijaynagar and new plants in Hatta (MP) and UP (timeline not specified).\n- It aims to cut costs by up to *₹400/tonne* in 12–18 months (₹200/tonne already achieved), with subsidies in Rajasthan and Punjab and improved EBITDA, while staying behind peers like Nuvoco.

items.title: HCCB signs MoUs for SHINE in Maharashtra
items.summary:
- *Hindustan Coca-Cola Beverages* signed MoUs with Pune, Ratnagiri, Palghar and Jalgaon to drive inclusive development under Project SHINE in Maharashtra. 
- The partnerships focus on *women empowerment*, water access, healthcare, education, youth skilling, and include initiatives such as electric vehicles for waste collection and upgrades to schools and health centres. 
- Chief Minister *Devendra Fadnavis* and HCCB executives hailed the collaboration as a catalyst for rural and tribal growth, noting that Project SHINE has already impacted over 1.2 lakh people.
